w:r.w:t: Product Requirement Document: ShikshaCare (AI-Powered EduTech + HealthTech Platform)
ShikshaCare is an integrated web platform leveraging AI to holistically address two critical student challenges:
functionalities (career guidance, adaptive learning paths, skill validation) with
components (mental health assessments, stress monitoring, and AI-guided support) into a single, unified experience.
Students in Higher Education, Rural & Underserved Learners.
Develop a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) demonstrating core features and the seamless integration of EduTech and HealthTech modules.
Modern students, particularly those from diverse socio-economic backgrounds, face a double bind:
Overwhelming choices, lack of clear guidance, and a mismatch between academic skills and industry demands. This leads to wasted time, poor job readiness, and frustration.
Academic pressure, future anxiety, and lack of accessible, private mental health support result in high stress levels, burnout, and reduced learning capacity.
There is currently no single platform that holistically links learning with well-being, treating the student as an integrated entity.
To be the worldâ€™s leading AI-powered companion that guides every student to a successful career while ensuring their mental well-being is prioritized and maintained.
Show how AI can generate a personalized, career-aligned learning roadmap.
Visually connect learning progress (Skill Score) with mental state (Stress Index).
Implement a basic mental health self-assessment and AI-guided stress management tip.
Present a clean, intuitive, and mobile-responsive interface.
The platform is designed to serve:
Seeking clarity in specialization, internship guidance, and managing academic/social stress.
Lack access to professional career counselors; need structured, low-cost/free, adaptive learning.
Undecided on their path; need a diagnostic tool to map interests to high-demand careers.
20 years old, 2nd year B.Tech student (Computer Science) from a Tier-2 college.
Overwhelmed by the number of coding technologies; constantly stressed about choosing a specialization; feels inadequate compared to peers. No one to talk to about his anxiety.
A clear, step-by-step path to becoming a specific role (e.g., Data Scientist) and tools to manage his anxiety when facing tough academic deadlines.
No clear career roadmap after college.
Wasted effort on irrelevant skills; anxiety about the future.
Low engagement; skills do not match industry demand.
Mental health support is inaccessible or stigmatized.
Stress/burnout leads to reduced learning capacity and attrition.
Disconnected tools for learning and well-being.
Students treat their mental health and academic life as separate, often conflicting, priorities.
An AI-driven assessment guides the student to a specific career (e.g., UI/UX Designer). The AI then creates a granular, adaptive roadmap of skills, quizzes, and projects to achieve that goal.
Monitors self-reported mental state and academic workload. It provides quick, AI-guided stress checks, personalized relaxation exercises, and insights into the student's mental well-being over time.
A unified dashboard uses the student's learning progress as a variable in their stress score calculation, encouraging a balanced approach.
"ShikshaCare is the only platform that seamlessly fuses AI-driven, goal-oriented learning with proactive, personalized mental health support, ensuring students are not just skilled, but also well."
Holistic view of the student (Learning & Well-being in one dashboard).
Adaptive learning paths and context-aware mental health support via AI.
Designed for high-impact use in rural and underserved communities (mobile-first, low-bandwidth considerations).
Short diagnostic quiz to map interests/aptitudes to 3-5 high-demand careers.
Basic fixed quiz with static output mapping to one career path.
Detailed, step-by-step learning path (e.g., Day 1: Learn Python Basics).
Display a 5-step fixed roadmap for the selected career path.
Contextual quizzes tied to roadmap milestones.
One multiple-choice quiz per roadmap step.
Display a mock "Skill Score" (0-100%) based on quiz completion.
Short, privacy-focused assessment (e.g., GAD-7, PHQ-9 inspired questions) for stress/anxiety.
A visual, quantifiable score (0-100) reflecting the student's current mental state.
based on the 3-question check and mock learning load.
Provides personalized tips, relaxation techniques, and encouragement based on the Stress Index.
Display one static, context-aware tip (e.g., "Take a 15-minute break," if Stress Index is high).
Single view showing Skill Score and Stress Index side-by-side.
Core feature: The main landing page.
Student signs up and completes the Career Mapping AI Quiz.
AI suggests a career (e.g., "Cloud Architect"), and a personalized roadmap is generated.
Student completes Step 1 of the roadmap, takes the corresponding Skill Validation Quiz, and their Skill Score updates.
Student is prompted to take the "Stress Check" assessment.
Based on a high Stress Index, the system provides an AI-Guided Support Tip (e.g., a 2-minute breathing exercise).
Student views the Unified Dashboard, seeing the interplay between their learning progress and mental well-being.

[A diagram illustrating a three-tier architecture: 1. Presentation Layer (Web Browser/Mobile App) connected via API Gateway to 2. Application Layer (Backend Logic & AI Microservices) which interacts with 3. Data Layer (PostgreSQL & Vector Database for RAG).]
The platform follows a microservice-oriented architecture:
Handles user authentication, roadmap management, and quiz logic.
Dedicated service for generating roadmaps (using RAG/LLM) and providing stress-check analysis.
Stores user progress and assessment history.
Fast development, component-based structure, highly responsive for mobile-first design.
Excellent for rapid prototyping; seamless integration with AI/ML libraries.
Robust, scalable, and reliable data storage.
The MVP will focus on the core integration loop:
Goal â†’ Path â†’ Progress â†’ Check-in â†’ Insight
Fixed 5-question form leading to a single static career path.
A simple completion button/checkbox for each step.
One static, conditional tip based on Stress Index.
Placeholder section on the dashboard for future features.
These features are out of scope for the hackathon but represent the platform's potential for growth:
Calendar/time management integration to automatically calculate workload stress.
Moderated, anonymous student forums and mentorship matching.
Contextual project-based learning, dynamic roadmap adjustments based on real-time Skill Score decay.
Advanced biometric integration (via smartwatch APIs) to monitor sleep, heart rate, and activity levels.
Direct links from completed roadmaps to job boards and internships.
For the Hackathon judging, the primary success metrics are qualitative and focus on feasibility and vision:
Successful demonstration of the end-to-end loop (Goal to Unified Dashboard).
How clearly the platform solves the dual problem of career confusion and mental stress.
Clean, robust code and a logical system architecture.
Daily Active Users (DAU) / Monthly Active Users (MAU)
>60% of students complete their first roadmap within 3 months.
10% reduction in average cohort Stress Index over a 6-week period.
